intro: Saurauia melegritoi, commonly known as the Sierra Madre snowberry, is a shrub native to the high-altitude regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its small, white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant produces bright red berries that are edible and often consumed by local wildlife. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
